values:
My next 101 in 1001; not sure when it will start & end, but Oct 20, 2011 to July 18, 2014; will build up the list until it's filled.


1. grow my nails [Nov/Dec 2011]
2. write more letters
3. cultivate a garden
4. try contact lenses
5. take flamenco
6. learn more about plants and survival skills
7. make a zine
8. make my own tea
9. see Sam Roberts perform 
10. knit a hammock
11. go surfing
12. donate blood
13. write more poetry
14. milk a goat
15. memorize origami
16. make a list of 100 good things that have happened to me and draw inspiration from them
<s>17. learn more poi</s> [joined a local spinners group -- poi, hooping, lots of lovely people! // Jan 2012: learned reverse three beat weave, butterfly, reverse butterfly. I'd say goal accomplished!]
18. get my fortune read
19. go on a retreat
20. visit Gampo Abbey
21. do the Artist's Way course 
22. sleep in a hammock
23. make my own root beer
24. record an album
25. spend a day under Ethan's rules
26. roll in mud
27. buy a guitar [May 2012]
28. pimp out my bike/splurge on a NICE bike
29. pick my own strawberries
30. camp the Cabot Trail
31. complete graphic novel draft
32. keep consistent blog journal
33. graduate from university (yeah!)
34. find a spiritual community that supports me
35. be published
36. catalogue my wardrobe
37. become as fluent in Spanish as I am in French
38. begin studying another language (thinking of German, Japanese, Russian, Hebrew)
39. join/start band (or have regular jam group)
40. community theatre
41. do a trip only via bicycle
42. write a letter to myself to open at the end of my 1001 days [Dec 2012: should do this soon!]
43. relearn piano
44. get a bookcase/bookshelves [I want a dark wood leaning ladder shelf, but they are super cher!]
45. properly frame the artwork I have 
46. ship my paintings from Saskatoon [being shipped summer '12]
47. finish/release a Snowbabies album
48. work on Katimavik graphic novel
49. re-read all of Sandman [Nov-Dec 2011, read vol.1; Dec'11-Jan'12, vol.2]
50. keep a notebook of all the poetry and quotes that I love
51. travel to Boston
52. introduce friends to Cape Breton (obviously lacking in their lives!)
53. grow my hair to my waist (then potentially cut it all off)
54. explore local art galleries
55. improve guitar playing
56. knit a pair of socks [Jan-Feb '12]
57. expand LP collection
58. choreograph a hoop dance performance
59. choreograph a poi performance
60. try fire hooping and/or fire poi
61.

summer summary:
stopped being vegetarian. Love it.
started attending church regularly again. Love it!
travelled to Ottawa & Montreal. saw Taylor Swift in concert (she's pretty amazing).
moved to Halifax, started classes at MSVU. LOVE IT. I'm also working there and it's pretty awesome.
have good roomies, a good house rental, a good job, good classes, AMAZING supportive friends, a friggin WICKED farmer's market, practically anything my little organic local free range heart desires, and a bank full of student loans. 

still broken hearted, but life goes on.
MyHeritage: Celebrity Collage - Free printable family tree - Family reunion

I LOVE LYDIA LEGAULT!!


just because. :)

i'm in Moose Jaw! and it's FREEZING!
we landed in -47 and it's -30 today.

i have two new jobs: working at a francophone school, Ecole Ducharme, and the Western Development Museum.
i'm house manager this week with Anna, so i haven't done anything exciting yet.

we go to the Y quite regularly. they have a biking game set up where you chase dragons. this is my new exercise regimen.

my bipolar is acting up again a bit; cycles are being disruptive and i spent a good part of yesterday just laying in bed. here's hoping it's just the weather and adjustments to Saskatchewan.

my new cluster is pretty awesome. they were in Halifax and Bridgewater previously, so i had some good chats about my greatly missed city.

my head is being pulled in two directions, the West Coast and Montreal. i don't know what to do except wait.

my work gave me a very sweet goodbye. one gift i received was Gifts of Unknown Things by Lyall Watson. it's extremely interesting and makes me think (always a good thing).

give me courage to work in French next week! i'm terrified!
me and lydia at the Frontiersman in Coombs driving to Port Alberni me and lydia making food during HM week goodbye cake from work weeeeeeeeeeeeee new hair! now you see it! now you don't!

first things first!! my address as of January 15th (one week from today) will be:

973 James St
Moose Jaw, SK
S6H 3H5

phone: (306) 693-1217 


next things next!!
today my work place GAVE ME A BANJO. FOR FREEEEEEEEEEE. case, books and everything! i need to get the strings changed and buy a tuner, but OH YES! my plans for two-double-oh-nine are moving along fabulously.

[jan 7: i don't have 101 goals YET. i'm only at 66, but i'll add more as i go feb 18: added more goals (at 71 now), crossed off a few things! mar 18: added more goals, up to 81; made some changes & edits! july 13: crossed off more. need to add the remaining goals. have up to 101 but need to post them! aug 19: hit 101! crossed off one. sept 23: revised one or two. crossed off a few! dec 26: crossed off one; reviewing for 2010 2010: sept 27: crossed off a few. edited one or two. dec 20: crossed off one or two 2011: oct 20: late finishing up, did final cross-offs and count] FINAL TALLY: Completed: 41/101 Not completed & continuing: 35/101 January 1, 2009 - Sept 29, 2011 (or, age 21 - age 24) 1. live with more confidence, self assurance and passion Still something I'm working on, but have definitely come a long way from 2009 2. take more initiative in all aspects of my life Done like dinner! 3. grow my nails 4. get another piercing body mod (piercing/tattoo/etc) June10: got third ear piercings done 5. improve my French Definitely improved and still improving 6. write more letters 7. finish Katimavik June 24/09! 8. get the ball rolling on starting my own business Dec09: getting the foundation started, but not enough to cross this off yet. Oct11: never did get this going, and don't plan on it. 9. buy a banjo Jan7/09; turns out that i didn't even have to buy a banjo because someone gave one to me! 10. cultivate the family A garden 11. learn Russian The motivation is still there, but unsure if I'm going to focus on Russian or a different language. I'm leaning more towards Hebrew or Swedish 12. practice nonviolent communication An awesome communication skill to have; defuses tension very successfully! 13. be as vegan and raw as possible making the best effort possible. Oct11: was vegan for almost all of this 101in1001, reverted to vegetarian in Jan11, reverted to seafood in Sept 11. Delicious, no plans on changing. 14. try contact lenses 15. WWOOFing (NZ or Isle of Man) researched a little; planning for future. Oct11: not sure if I really want to 16. cross continent travelling & exploring with Caitlin trips to Van Island, Paris, who knows? Oct11: didn't travel with Caitlin, but I did travel across Canada 4-5 times since Jan09 17. organize an actual singing gig Okay, so it wasn't a "gig", but I've sung in public twice, so I'm counting those 18. take up bellydancing 19. sprouting! Dec 2010: have sprouted chickpeas since spring '10 20. learn more about plants and survival skills 21. learn more ASL 22. do more yoga Oct11: attempted to start a daily habit in late Dec10. didn't stick, but am trying again! 23. go to bed earlier. Did this for a long time because of work. Aimed at making it a routine again. 24. wake earlier. change my inner clock to 6-6:30am Same as above 25. make more of my own clothing Can count this as "done", but will continue 26. grow my hair out Changing this to freely experimenting with my hair. Done Jan 09, and onward! Dec09: ironically, am growing out my hair now! Aiming for belly button length. Sept10: shaved my head for cancer research in Feb, am now growing it out as long as possible before getting dreads. Oct11: got dreads in May11, combed them out during the summer, am now growing as long as possible 27. learn more about being a doula 28. make a zine still want to do this! 29. delete all pictures from Facebook; transfer all uploading to Flickr Sept10: this really isn't even a goal of mine anymore. not sure what to do about it. Oct11: yup, definitely abandoning this goal 30. work at a free school a goal to keep on my bucket list, but removing from future 101in1001s 31. make my own tea 32. only give homemade or fair trade gifts Tried my best, was pretty successful! will continue 33. survive on dumpster diving for a week/month/season 34. write and record more songs as of summer 09, going beautifully. Oct11: I've written, recorded, and performed quite a few songs and have a hilarious lowfi band with my sister 35. hooping! Sept10: started hooping in May10, now own 6 hoops & loving it! 36. be an amazing aunt! I think I'm pretty awesome with kids now! 37. celebrate my 24th birthday in Paris with people i love! <3 Dec 2010: I definitely won't be making it to Paris, so I'm just going to have an amazing birthday! Oct11: Yup, didn't make it to Paris, but had a nice birthday with people i love in Halifax 38. don't eat minimal processed or junk food (a girl's gotta have a indulgence!) Oct11: yeah, definitely didn't follow this. Don't really care anymore! 39. see Sam Roberts perform this NEEDS to happen 40. meet Dallas Green Don't really care anymore, my Dallas phase ended! 41. do morning pages started Feb17/09; ended shortly after. am going to restart! Oct11: Never restarted them. May try again. 42. have a child out of love No babies here 43. experience natural (as possible) birth bucket list! 44. visit every province and territory in Canada as of Aug09, have only Nfld & territories! Oct11: still only have Nfld & territories left! 45. use DivaCup, Lunapads (or make my own) done Jan09. aww yeah! love my DivaCup! 46. attend a raw festival 47. knit a hammock 48. fall in love happened way long ago; dusted off, polished & wearing <3 on sleeve!... June09, starting again. see: #97 49. go surfing 50. donate blood 51. attend an indian wedding 52. milk a goat 53. memorize origami 54. make a list of 100 good things that have happened to me and draw inspiration from them 55. only use a reusable travel mug Received from work placement as a good-bye present :) 56. hold a bake sale for fundraising 57. learn more poi 58. live on a higher level of consciousness 59. go back to school Sept10: started studies at U of Saskatchewan. Oct11: transferred to MSVU, loving it! 60. use natural birth control I track my cycles and body temps 61. have a wedding MY way Not happening anymore, but now have good idea of what I'd want 62. knit something new every month I need to start blogging these! Oct11: failed pretty badly, but it was a pretty weird goal to begin with 63. get my fortune read 64. be a responsible consumer 65. go on a retreat 66. visit Gampo Abbey 67. survive a Saskatchewan winter done April 1/09. Sept10: it's ironic that I live here now & this will be my 3rd Sask winter! 68. finish 1st rotation done Jan 15/09 69. finish 2nd rotation done April 1/09 70. finish 3rd rotation done June 24/09 71. do the Artist's Way course 72. sleep in a hammock 73. streamline my wardrobe Sept10: after major flooding this summer, I had to pare down a lot of my clothes. It felt good & now I can easily dress myself, haha. 74. do an activity with my sister each week (summer 09) Sept09: revised to doing activities & staying close with my sisters 75. move into my OWN place (vs. rentshare) Moved in Dec '09 76. document all my creativity 77. develop my freelance writing portfolio 78. make my own root beer 79. geocache in every province 80. enter a dance competition/tournament (for partners) 81. go to SxSW 82. sleep at Anna's house Done! Aug27/09 83. record an album Getting there! 84. spend a day under Ethan's rules 85. roll in mud 86. buy a guitar 87. pimp out my bike 88. pick my own strawberries 89. camp the Cabot Trail 90. eat at Pink Sushi with Mary & Jen 91. create a blog done! 92. get a Pro account on Flickr 93. go to Egypt and climb a pyramid 94. learn a French song June 09 - Reviens-moi par Deny Bedard 95. learn Spanish taking Spanish at school in Jan11 96. get an SLR camera 97. fall in love. again. Happened way sooner than I ever thought it would. August09. Oct11: Ended our relationship in April'11. Now back to square one. Taking it slow, loving myself FIRST! 98. visit all of my group members at least once Oct11: Have seen 6/10 people in person. Have kept in touch with all of them! 99. go back to Parksville Aug09, so nice! 100. join a band Started The Snowbabies with my sister 101. have a job that I LOVE Oct11: various library jobs! feel free to give me suggestions or ideas or criticism! if anyone can help give me any kind of push, shove or gentle nudge toward any of these, by all means, push away!

i knew that i had made a list before, and i found it on my old LJ.

so here it is, updated with what i've accomplished!!


1. learn russian.
2. knit something wearable. Done several times over
3. live alone.
4. go surfing.
5. collaborate with someone on a song. Oct/Nov 2008
6. write real letters. (and send them) Accomplished!
7. work for a cause that i care about. Sept 2008-June 2009: volunteering!
8. crash a wedding.
9. steal my name sign.
10. develop my own photography. Working on it. Have my Flickr
11. get my license.
12. learn one respectable dance move (moonwalk excluded :P)
13. donate blood.
14. take a road trip all over north america. (south america if someone speaks spanish/portugeuse) Not accomplished, but planned for summer 09 or 10
15. get a huge map and pin everywhere i've been. (aim for lots of pins)
16. read "war and peace". understand it.
17. leave something beautiful in a public space.
18. stop cursing.
19. skysurf.
20. play spin the bottle. Umm.. done. Haha.
21. go to the opera. (preferably for madame butterfly)
22. give my lover 1000 Hershey Kisses.
23. open a can of whoopass on a KKK member.
24. calm my temper. Accomplished. I'm much more calm and patient.
25. visit paris with my s.o.
26. wear my heart on my sleeve. Mmhmm.
27. keep forgiving, but remember not to forget.
28. keep a diary of coincidences. Record of Extraordinary Events!
29. learn the songs of phantom of the opera in french. DONE!
30. have faith in love and find my soul's doppelganger.
31. dance on a float in mardi gras.
32. attend an indian wedding.
33. milk a cow.
34. travel for three months with one carry-on bag
35. stop craving material things.
36. volunteer actively. In progress!
37. work out for as much time each day as I spend eating.
38. read all of Proust.
39. fill a book with conspiracies.
40. emcee an event.
41. learn to track in the woods.
42. get a tattoo.
43. skinnydip under a waterfall.
44. avoid cliches. Actively trying to avoid becoming and applying.
45. learn to read music (again).
46. find a pearl in an oyster.
47. learn origami by heart.
48. do more yoga.
49. wear a sari with believable grace.
50. throw a dinner party.
51. live so that my behaviour causes no embarrassment to anyone - especially me.
52. eat vegan for a month. June 2006
53. bake a four-layer cake from scratch.
54. wear hats all year. Done!
55. compose a (real) song. Oct-Nov 08 w/Anna
56. send a message in a bottle and get a reply.
57. spend a day blindfolded.
58. have a wardrobe consisting only of materials I've got secondhand or for free. Almost there!
59. become ambidexterous.
60. get a platinum card and never have to use it.
61. have a suit made to order.
62. spend the week before Christmas as a Salvation Army bell ringer.
63. celebrate a buy-nothing Christmas.
64. stretch my mind and body in new directions. On-going project.
65. try everything offered to me at least once. Still going...
66. go on a fast for health. Done.
67. adopt a pet from the SPCA.
68. nap in a tree.
69. on my birthday, treat myself to chocolate at every meal.
70. celebrate the holidays of every religion. In progress.
71. drink wine that is older than I am.
72. celebrate half-birthdays.
73. find my own philosophy of living. Found. Living it!
74. write my manifesto.
75. update my memoirs every New Years.
76. join a singing group.
77. change my worst personality trait. In progress.
78. take revenge on someone who really deserves it.
79. design my perfect desk, then build it myself.
80. finish all sewing projects in one month from the day I start them.
81. make a list of 100 good things that have happened to me and draw inspiration and strength from them daily.
82. change gender for a week, just to see what it's like.
83. jump doubledutch.
84. learn to skateboard.
85. make creme brulee.
86. drink dandelion wine & tea.
87. try a love potion.
88. take a nap in tall grass.
89. be carried across a puddle.
90. dance in and get soaked from a warm summer rain.
91. hold a flea market.
92. rebel with a real cause.
93. live as wastefree as possible.
94. give someone a second chance. Done several times over.
95. be given a second chance. Also done several times over. I have amazing people in my life.
96. regain my sense of smell.
97. be able to say "a lady never tells her age" and be convincingly ageless.
98. find a church I connect with and attend services regularly. Veto-ed in favour of a more personal choice.
99. dress a scarecrow in the latest fashion.
100. learn as many yo-yo tricks as I can.
101. gain the ability to nap anywhere, anytime. Getting there!


I'll update my new one soon!

I'm incredibly excited for 2009 and beyond! Make goals! LIVE YOUR DREAMS!!
YOU CAN DO IT!! The only thing stopping you is your doubts and fears. Conquer those beasts!!

i miss writing.
i used to sit in coffeeshops or the library with my laptop and write for hours about anything and everything that was on my mind, the people around me, any inspiration that sparked connections between words in my mind.


one of my favourite writing activities:
go into a coffeeshop or restaurant. 
have your laptop open in front of you.
get a big cup of something delicious.
adopt a look of preoccupation.
open a blank word or notepad document.
eavesdrop on neighbouring tables and write down what you hear.


i miss my laptop and i miss all my writing files. :(
i'm trying to keep up with writing and keep the sparkplugs going but it is difficulttttttt.

ideas for the future! 

- moving 
- CSNN 
- NSCAD 
- travelling!! 
- rings on my fingers 
- babies! 
- learning 
- WWOOFing ... ? 
- isle of man!!! 
- retreat(s) 
- being raw again(!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i seriously cannot wait for this) 
- self sustainable minus a 9-5 dull environment 
- cross country trip(s) 
- cruise with the girls 
- buddhist holidays 
- meditating 
- doing yoga more often 
- journaling more creatively 
- doing more creativity exercises 



what are your plans for the future?

today i ate indian, chinese and mexican food. i also felt sick. haha.

lately i've been feeling so consistently happy and it just encourages me to be happier. (^_^)b


they had a snowstorm in NS and lost power and someone asked me to fly home to go sledding on Citadel Hill and i missed NS and snow and winter so much for a few moments that my heart hurt.

i am truly an East Coast lady and i wouldn't trade it for the world.

Once upon a time, a girl named Enid came home from conversing with the goddesses to find a small package laying in front of her door. Inside was a small bulb which she placed into a pot of soil and watered and tended to daily. One day the plant began to flower and a small blonde child emerged. Enid begat her the name von Blondie and from that day forth, they were an inseparable creative force beyond measure. They are known as The Snowbabies and they do as they please.




i miss my snowbaby sister an insane amount.



i am billeting and i LOVE IT!! they are treating me like a princess and giving me clothes and letting me make whatever food i want to and sit on their couch and read and knit and use their computer and I LOVE IT!!



today someone told me that i have a Betty Boop body and then told me other hilarious cute things. 



i'm reading The BUST Guide to the New Girl Order and simutaneously growing as a feminist and strengthening my adoration for men. i have so many seriously amazing, strong and loveable men in my life! men who don't judge or belittle, men who accept and and cuddle and hug and love love love!!

today is a day for afternoon naps and long drives and chai tea and the soft hum of leonard cohen turned down very very low.


i adore my coworkers! they take me for drives in the country and shopping at the thrift store across the street and they make me herbal tea for when i arrive at work and again for after lunch.



a housemate asked me to sing him soft tunes, so i sang and a voice came from between my lips that i've never heard from before. i don't know what brought this voice into being, but i would like this voice to stay.
i would like to believe that BC is making my voice beautiful again (but to be honest it's most likely because i'm not smoking anymore). 


i leave for billeting very soon! i'm nervous, but excited!

happiness is dancing with awesome boys to awesome music!
and having a drive back by curfew!
and listening to maritime bands on the opposite coast!


weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!!


i love life! i love katimavik! 



d(^_^)b times infinity!!

so the Universe can totally read my life right now!

" Laughter, new friends, and far away travel. Wildlife, unexplored jungles, and hidden lagoons. Adventure, ancient mysteries, and modern cities. Challenges, heroes, and passionate love.

You deserve it ALL, Alex.

So do I.

Would you mind visualizing for us?

Boots on,
    The Universe"


woohoo!!

silly geese!

honest communication is obviously the best way to get your complete point across and to be heard fairly and openly!



p.s. i LOVE my group for being open minded and open hearted and so so lovely!
love X infinity exists here.

debuting.... the happy list!!
made of up things that make me oh-so-happy right now!
- groupmates
- having yummy veg food
- eating with my hands (!!!)
- having piles of veg*n cookbooks around
- working with hilarious people
- receiving encouragement in a million different ways from a million different people (hello! and thank you! notes of the universe!!)
- feeling like i am being loved and accepted unconditionally

life is beautiful!

i think it's a bad sign when i'm enjoying my work life more than my group life. 


i'm "storming" like a hurricane.

mamihlapinatapei (yagán)

(definition:)

a look shared by two people with each wishing that the other will initiate something that both desire but neither one wants to start.

from gala!





i'm tired and my legs are sore and i slept for five hours and my PC is coming today and i'm doing a french workshop and i have too much on my plate right now.
i miss my dog and my sisters and Halifax friends. :(

right now, i feel very disconnected and i don't like it.

edit:
my sisters called and left me the world's most hilarious voicemail and they told me all about their crazy adventures and GAHHHH i miss them so much!
i don't know anyone else who is practically best friends with their siblings. no one understands this!!

" When you look around you, Alex, at those in the world who flourish, thrive, laugh, and love - with friendships, adventure, even abundance - aren't they, more often than not, first and foremost, the dreamers?

You so have it made,
    The Universe"


i so DO have it made.
dream on!

[posting more katima-things here until the library has a blog.com compatible browser.]

- having three days of work consisting of a) bowling, b) swimming, and c) a Hallowe'en dance party.
- having a young guy at the dance party declare me and Lyndsi his girlfriends (along with "shmoochy-woochy's", "sweethearts", "sweetie pies", and my personal fave, "chocolate cheesecake!")
- walking around town wearing giant wings
- meeting awesome katimavik alumni who let us visit at ungodly hours
- biking around in tights and dresses
- being a 5 minute bike ride from everything
- living next to a beach/park
- having the weather NOT be freezing :D today's temp was 14 degrees. suck on that, NS!


as of yesterday, i've been in katimavik for ONE MONTH! i love my group, my work, and all the awesome people i've met so far (although those ones at the beach were sort of dicey... not going to lie!). i've having so much fun and i'm really happy that i'm doing this.

love all you loads!
i've been a. listening to b. dreaming about c. way too in love with this guy right now.
i want to play music on a bus.

join StyleMob! 
good until the end of June. :)
